moves.1. e4 Nc6 2. Nf3 e5: Nimzovich defense. I'm playing white. I actually had no idea what this was called until I looked it up in the Openings DB.
moves.7. d4: I threaten his pawn for control of center.
moves.7... b6: Not sure what he's doing here.
moves.8. b3: I don't know why I didn't take that pawn.
moves.8... d6: He defends his pawn, it's too late for me to capture now.
moves.9. d5: I try to stop his capturing my pawn, and gain control of the center.
moves.10. Bb2: I let him take my bishop.
moves.12. Nb5: Moving my knight out of my bishop's way.
moves.13... Ng4: He moves his knight out of the way so he can take my pawn.
moves.14. Qd2: I do not notice his attack on my pawn, and double my rooks up.
moves.15. g3: I try to get his bishop out, and avoid a fork on f2.
moves.16. a4: I make way for my rook.
moves.16... f5: Trying to take my pawn off the center.
moves.18. Nh4: I try to shoo his bishop off.
moves.19... Qxh4: And he takes. He's slowly picking off my pawns, one by one.
moves.20... Nh6: And he finally gets his knight out.
moves.21... Rac8: He moves his rook out of danger.
moves.22. Ne6: I move my knight out of danger only to attack his other rook.
moves.22... Rf7: Again, trying to get his rook out.
moves.24. Ne4: And again, slowly gettting my knight to safety.
moves.24... Rxc4: Big mistake. He might not have seen that knight attacking his rook.
moves.25. Nxf6+ Qxf6: I take and he takes back.
moves.26. f4: Not sure why I did that, maybe to grab an open file for my rook.
moves.26... Rxc2: He takes a different pawn and forks me.
moves.28... Rxb2: Ouch. Did not see that. Now I'm losing.
moves.30. Rec1: I'm trying to get my rook on c6.
moves.32... Rh3: Moving his rook out of danger.
moves.36... Nc4: Goes for my rook. That was a mistake.
moves.37. Rc6: Free pawn for me if his knight moves.
moves.38. Kg5: Now I'm threatening both his bishop and knight.
moves.38... Be4: What? I would have done Bd4, saving the knight.
moves.41... Rg2+ 42. Kh4 Rg4+ 43. Kh3 Rxa4: He gets my pawn by checking. At this point I realize that he might promote one of those pawns, which would not end up well for me.
moves.44. Rxb6: Well, I have to take his pawns.
moves.46. Kh3 Ra3+ 47. Kh4 Ra4+ 48. Kh3: I do not have much hope of a win now. I get a draw by three-fold repetition.
